SEARCH
Package model.entities

Class MyDate

java.lang.Object
model.entities.MyDate
public class MyDate extends Object
A custom date and time representation class that provides functionality for handling dates and times in the train booking system. This class can represent both date-only and date-time values, and provides conversion methods to work with Java's standard date/time classes. The class stores date components (day, month, year) and optional time components (hour, minute) as separate integer fields for easy manipulation and access.
Author:
Jan Lewek, Teodora Stoicescu, Bianca Buzdugan

  • Constructor Details

    • MyDate

      public MyDate(int day, int month, int year, int hour, int minute)
      Constructs a MyDate with specified date and time components. This constructor creates a complete date-time representation.
      Parameters:
      day - the day of the month (1-31)
      month - the month of the year (1-12)
      year - the year
      hour - the hour of the day (0-23)
      minute - the minute within the hour (0-59)

    • MyDate

      public MyDate(int year, int month, int day)
      Constructs a MyDate with only date components.
      Parameters:
      year - the year
      month - the month of the year (1-12)
      day - the day of the month (1-31)

    • MyDate

      public MyDate(Date sqlDate)
      Constructs a MyDate from a SQL Date object. Time components are set to 0 since SQL Date only contains date information.
      Parameters:
      sqlDate - the SQL Date to convert from, or null

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares this MyDate with the specified object for equality. Two MyDate objects are considered equal if all their date and time components match.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this date in DD/MM/YYYY format. Time components are not included in the string representation.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a formatted string representation of the date

    • toSqlDate

      public Date toSqlDate()
      Converts this MyDate to a SQL Date object. Only the date components are used; time information is lost.
      Returns:
      a SQL Date representation of this date
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the date values are invalid

    • toLocalDateTime

      public LocalDateTime toLocalDateTime()
      Converts this MyDate to a LocalDateTime object. All date and time components are included in the conversion.
      Returns:
      a LocalDateTime representation of this date and time

    • getDate

      public Date getDate()
      Converts this MyDate to a SQL Date object. This method provides error handling and debugging information if conversion fails. Only the date components are used; time information is lost.
      Returns:
      a SQL Date representation of this date
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the date string cannot be converted to a valid SQL Date

    • toSqlTime

      public Time toSqlTime()
      Converts this Time to a SQL Time object.
      Returns:
      a SQL Time representation of this time
